course.title: C# Intermediate: Classes, Interfaces and OOP
course.subtitle: An in-depth, step-by-step guide to classes, interfaces and object-oriented programming (OOP) with C#

reviews.body: Great course, I have done all exercises. I may was confused with last one. It not not obvious to add one extra method to interface because you ask to do it with only 2 methods first.

Great course, I learned a lot. Good explanations in every chapter, except Interfaces.

I found it hard to follow, especially the Unit Test part is confussing.

In some videos maybe you should be careful when you introduce a keyword or functionality about certain programming topic that hasn't been taught (like the "using" keyword in the section 6, 34th lecture). I think that it would be better if you teach it in a separate lecture.

Still a very good course. Thanks for taking the time to do it!
This course is so good. This course does not only teach C#. But also C# best practices. The instructor is so experienced.

I enjoyed learning from this course. I have bought all 3 courses from the C# series of Mosh. It is always fun to learn new concepts and put them into practice by doing exercises. Thank you Mosh for sharing your knowledge with us. Looking forward to starting C# Advanced Topics soon.

The Beginner was ok. But as for intermediate, as some of the rating mentioned.. it is not easy to follow because Mosh introduces new things with not much of information that you constantly have to pause and search for what you don't understand. I now realized that I should have listened to the others in the bad comments..

Everything is well presented and engaging.

Coding examples help to better understand the concepts presented.

Well done.

Thanks.
The course was worth going over a few times to really understand the material. It is dense and well paced. The level of detail is amazing.

Mosh is very knowledgeable and his lecture is well organized. I've been taking several classes. Onething I don't like about his lecture is, he mentioned Resharper way too many times. Lots of us don't want to purchase it. His repetition about how to use it etc. is really annoying. I wish he stop talking about it.

I really fell in love with Mosh's way of teaching. He just not only simplifies the concepts, but also suggests the don'ts in order to be a great developer. He even inspires one to learn more and more.

Although I continued with this course from the previous one, I got many questions about abstract classes, interfaces and I had to search for them in different courses or on the Internet. And still not familiar with interfaces well. Will need to take another course, but Mosh's course could be more detailed. Excited after first course, not so happy after this one. Not taking the following one.

Very good explanations and very clear. The idea that is not necessary to call John a chef as long as the attributes of John are fulfilled by any other person is very good presented in regards of loose coupling. :)

instructor.name: Mosh Hamedani
instructor.briefIntroduction:
Hi! My name is Mosh (Moshfegh) Hamedani! I'm a passionate software engineer with two decades of experience and I've taught over 3 million people who to code or how to become professional software engineers through my YouTube channel and online courses.

My goal is to make software engineering fun and accessible to everyone. That's why my courses are simple, pragmatic and free of BS.

unitNames: What You are Going to Learn
Interfaces are NOT for Multiple Inheritance
Get My Other Courses with a Discount
